result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall colect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:  
Seek and maintain full time emloyment.
Cooperate  and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Submit to random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Curtis Woodruff

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense and defendant. 

Credit for 230 days time served if revoked.

AS TO COUNT 1 (MISDEMEANOR):  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT for 9 MONTHS, concurrent to any other sentence defendant is currently serving.  
Credit for 175 days time served if revoked.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Seek and maintain full-time employment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY DNA surcharge.  The Court ordered the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
 
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

FILED, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff not in court, in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea and Sentencing Hearing today.
Judge Donald is attending a family member's funeral.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 09-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Court GRANTS request.
**Court ordered defendant REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.
Case adjourned to 09-19-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.
Copy of defendant's employment resume; filed.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Jacob D. Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Bail/Bond Hearing AND Final Pretrial Conference.

Court addressed bail:  Defense motion for modification in bail to a decreased amount argued and DENIED.  Bail is to remain as $2,500.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point Pretrial Services for supervision.  Same conditions of release as previously ordered.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties remain in a trial posture and there are no trial issues at this time.
Court is down the latter part of the week that the Jury Trial is scheduled.
Court finds good cause to adjourn the Jury Trial date.
Case adjourned to 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for "SPEEDY" Jury Trial.
**Court CANCELLED the 07-28-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Bail/Bond Hearing and Scheduling Conference.
Case tabbed to Judge Witkowiak in error.
Statements made.
This court ACCEPTS this case based upon the lower case being tabbed to this court (ref. case# 13CF5039).
ADA Corr moves for joinder of both cases.
Atty. Guimont objects.
Arguments heard.
Court GRANTS State's motion and joins both cases for purposes of trial.

Court addressed bail:  Bail currently set at $2,500.00 cash.  Defense requests a bail modification to a signature bond with Justice Point monitoring, or in the alternative, a decreased bail amount.  State objects and requests bail to remain the same.  Arguments heard.  
Court DENIED defense's request and ordered the current bail of $2,500.00 cash and the release conditions to remain the same.

**Defense requests a speedy trial demand. 
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-16-2014 at 8:30 AM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 07-28-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Call from Deputy Court Clerk, Rosalyn Nelson, to inform Court that this file was tabbed to Branch 22 in error and will be transferred to Branch 02.   File and parties transferred to Judge Joseph Donald, Branch 02.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Thomas Potter for Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Roger Curtis Woodruff in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant enters a plea of not guilty as to misdemeanor count 1.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
